p: Following adjustment for age, sex, comorbidities, pregnancy, obesity, smoking history, early NAI treatment and systemic corticosteroid use, and coinfections, multivariate logistic regression models revealed that influenza A virus infection was associated with an increased risk of invasive ventilation ( OR: 3.824, 95% CI: 2.279–6.414, P < 0.001), ICU admission ( OR: 1.630, 95% CI: 1.074–2.473, P = 0.022) and 30-day mortality ( OR: 2.427, 95% CI: 1.568–3.756, P < 0.001) in Flu-p patients (Table 3).
